intro: Lepidadenia pallida, commonly known as the white-flowered rock daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, pale yellow to white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. Its leaves are usually narrow and linear, adapted to reduce water loss in dry environments. Lepidadenia pallida is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its unique floral display.
